thread.title: State encourages tourists to head to Lake Powell for holiday
thread.title_full: State encourages tourists to head to Lake Powell for holiday - seattlepi.com

author: seattlepi.com
title: State encourages tourists to head to Lake Powell for holiday
text:
PAGE, Ariz. (AP) â€” State environment officials say tourists heading to Lake Powell for the Labor Day holiday need not worry about the quality of the water following a mine spill.
The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality says analysis of the water shows it's safe for all uses.
A toxic plume unleashed from the Gold King mine near Silverton, Colorado, on Aug. 5 traveled roughly 300 miles through Colorado, New Mexico and Utah, to Lake Powell on the Arizona-Utah border.
Arizona environment officials say several agencies will continue monitoring the lake and assessing data related to the spill.
They say test results of water samples show that the Colorado River downstream of Lake Powell also is safe for recreation and agriculture, and as a drinking source.
